Docs.summary: Specifies a print controller that displays a document on a screen as a series of images.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, to use the print preview feature, you create an instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> class and set its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A> property. The PreviewPrintController is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog> classes, though you can use the PreviewPrintController when managing the display of your own print preview window.
When used with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog>, PreviewPrintController sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController> of the associated <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A> to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintControllerWithStatusDialog>, performs the print preview, and sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController> back to the original value.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> that is displayed during the print preview. After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to a graphic of a single page. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics>, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
For more information about printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.

> [!NOTE] > Anti-aliasing, also known as gray scaling, makes the print preview look better. However, the use of anti-aliasing can slow down the rendering speed. For more information about anti-aliasing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PreviewPrintController.UseAntiAlias%2A> property.

## Remarks Anti-aliasing, also known as gray scaling, uses several shades of gray around areas of curves and diagonals in text to give the text a smoother appearance.
> [!NOTE] > While using anti-aliasing makes the print preview look better, it can slow down the rendering speed.
